result.execSummary:
The defendant David P. Londo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $100 fine plus costs. Cash bond applied. 60 days to pay fine/costs or set up payment plan with the Clerk of Courts office.
Consecutive to 14-CF-127.  Huber release and good time granted. Credit for time served.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David P. Londo

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Door County Jail Request for Sentence Modification - defendant requests 30 day furlough to look for a job. Court denies request.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant David P. Londo in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must submit a DNA sample to the State of Wisconsin within 10 days and pay the applicable surcharge. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant David P. Londo in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Richards offers have been extended regarding both files. Defendant is accepting the State's offer but needs time to get employment and personal matters in order before starting his sentence. Atty Richards requests a plea hearing in 45 days. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant David P. Londo in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Richards indicates he needs to discuss a few matters with DA Pelrine before entering a plea, requests another status in 30 days. State has no objection to adjournment.  Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty plea. Status conference set for 4/30/15 at 10:00. Bond continues as is.

Defendant David P. Londo in court with attorney Steven G. Richards. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 2/24/15. (fingerprint card destroyed 7/14/15)

Defendant David P. Londo in court. Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by phone. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defense advises of hearing in underlying case, requests status be scheduled after that date. Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Status conference scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant David P. Londo appeared by video conference. Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by phone. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 3/2/15, 10:00.
